title: Digital-Supported Blended Learning-Based Mathematics Expert Collaboration Project Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Real-time collaborative environment using digital devices for mathematics problem-solving and project-based assessments

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to utilize digital tools for solving math problems in collaborative online learning environments.

During a one-week intensive course, learners conduct knowledge-sharing sessions with three peer learners using a blended learning platform (e.g., Google Classroom + Zoom) and provide structured feedback meeting at least four out of five feedback checklist items

Within one week, learners design at least two mathematical models (e.g., linear regression, probability models) tailored to corporate scenarios (e.g., inventory optimization, budget planning), validate them with real data to achieve at least 80% accuracy, and submit a project report
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
